item.title: Cure Other - Lunar Tab
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:7, topic:117935”][quote author=I Am Olan14 link=topic=167232.msg1555799#msg1555799 date=1183144172]
You either miss-spelt castOnPlayer or you haven’t added it.
[/quote]
Nope I have it… Its used for ice barrage and stuff. I’m thinking that because this is a case, and not a (spellID == 000) statement, the castOnPlayer does not work. So how would I make it so if I click on a “music” in my music tab, it will wait until I click again on another player - thus doing the cure other spell?[/quote]

Its called an if statement ;), not a (spellID == 000)

Read full topic

item.title: Cure Other - Lunar Tab
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

I dont have that file, but it works for ice burst and barrage and other spells… And I think I now know why… The magic and spell ID statements are in the void public void AttackMage(int index) which includes the line:

client castOnPlayer = (client) server.playerHandler.players[playerIndex];

So how can I let my case 16192 cooperate with castOnPlayer inside of the void AttackMage?

Read full topic

item.title: Cure Other - Lunar Tab
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

I’m making a Cure Other spell for a lunar tab im making myself. Here’s the code:

case 16192: //Lunar - Cure Other
	castOnPlayer.stillgfx(8, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX);
	castOnPlayer.sendMessage("You have been cured from your poison by "+playerName+"!");
	sendMessage("You cure "+castOnPlayer.playerName+" of his poison!");
	break;

(I havent done the cure poison part yet, does anybody know how to do that for this spell?)

And it seems like everything would work, but I get errors saying variable castOnPlayer isnt defined… but it is. I think it’s only because it’s a case and not a “magicID ==” or “spellID ==” statement. Would anybody know how to make this work?

Read full topic
